Talk_1_1:
<sp:3:0:2:0800><snd:Happy_01>Hey, I know that face!


And any face I know is the face of
a friend!

Please, Link. Help yourself to anything in
this shelter. It's all yours to <clr:0000>use as you
see fit<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0200><snd:Sad_01>But don't you dare go making a mess
of this place and kicking up dust!

<sp:3:0:2:0201>I spend so much time cleaning in here,
and there's still endless amounts of dust.

<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Think_01>Where does all this dust even come
from, anyway?
Talk_1_2:
<sp:3:0:2:0500><snd:Angry>Why? Why does this spot, specifically,
get so dusty?!

I'm fed up with all the dust.


<sp:3:0:2:0701>Anyhow. Help yourself to anything in this
shelter. It's all yours to <clr:0000>use however
you want<clr:ffff>.
<sp:3:0:2:0201><snd:Think>But don't you dare go making a mess of
this place and kicking up dust!
Talk_1_3:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Help yourself to anything in this shelter.
It's all yours to <clr:0000>use as you see fit<clr:ffff>.

<sp:3:0:2:0200><snd:Think_01>But don't you dare go making a mess
of this place and kicking up more dust!

<sp:3:0:2:0201>I went to town with a broom in here just a
bit ago, and POOF. MORE DUST.

<sp:3:0:2:0a00><snd:Sad_01>Where does this level of dust even come
from, anyway?
Talk_2_1:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Have you greeted the Goddess today?
She watches over Hyrule, you know.

Good morning, good night, see you later,
I'm home.

<snd:Chat_01>It's important to touch base with
the Goddess.
Talk_2_2:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Chat>Good morning, good night, see you later,
I'm home.

Those who don't converse with the
Goddess regularly are not to be trusted.
Talk_2_3:
<sp:3:0:2:0701>Have you said hi to the <clr:0000>horned statue<clr:ffff>?


After hearing the story from you, I make
sure to say hello to both the Goddess and
the <clr:0000>horned statue<clr:ffff> too.
<sp:3:0:2:0101><snd:LaughS_01>I never hear that frightening voice
anymore. I bet the horned statue is
feeling better for it too!
Talk_2_5:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Notice>What is it? I'm busy cleaning the dais for
the <clr:0000>horned statue<clr:ffff>.
Talk_2_6:
<sp:3:0:2:0c00>"A dealer in life and power, touched by
the wrath of the Goddess, fallen to ruin."

So the horned statue must be the entity
who deals in life and power...

<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Chat>Which would make the dais the place
where it was enshrined, back when
it was still a god.
As there is the Goddess of light, then it
follows that she would have an opposite—
the horned god.
Like light and dark, one cannot exist
without the other—their power manifests
through the other's existence.
<sp:3:0:2:0700>That's what I think, anyway. And that's
all I've got for you. I'm going back to
work now.
Talk_2_7:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Ease>Once I've cleaned up the <clr:0000>horned statue<clr:ffff>'s
dais, I've got the <clr:0000>Goddess Statue <clr:ffff>to tidy.
Talk_2_8:
<sp:3:0:2:0700><snd:Happy_00>I can't hear that frightening voice
anymore. I bet even the <clr:0000>horned
statue<clr:ffff> is feeling better now!
